sorular.soru: Are you allowed to flash the full-beam headlights to warn the driver in front of you?

feedback.metin: The driver of the passenger car in front of you has no lights on in the dark and is thus a danger on the road. To avert danger, you may flash the full-beam headlights to warn the driver in front of you.

sorular.soru: What is this sign warning you of?

feedback.metin: The J-1 sign falls under the category of warning signs and indicates that you are approaching a poor road surface. Sometimes an explanation is provided on an supplementary plate underneath.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to pick up or drop off a passenger?

feedback.metin: Drivers are not allowed to park their vehicle on the carriageway of a priority road outside built-up areas. Stopping to pick up or drop off passengers is allowed. Of course, this only applies if the traffic situation allows it and you drive away immediately after pick-up or drop-off. Stopping at the intersection is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Where does the speed limit in a 30 km/h zone apply?
cevaplar: Until the 'end of 30 km/h zone' sign.
sorular.dogruCevap: Until the 'end of 30 km/h zone' sign.

feedback.metin: If the word "zone" is placed above a traffic sign, this means the traffic sign applies to an entire area, until it is cancelled by the "end zone" sign.

sorular.soru: Can you pick up or drop off a passenger here?

feedback.metin: You are in front of an exit, where parking is prohibited – even if it is your own exit. However, you may stop here for a moment to quickly pick up or drop off passengers.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: You must give the cyclist right of way. This is an equivalent intersection, as signs do not regulate the right of way. Nor does it matter whether the road from the right is a cobbled road or an asphalt road, as both roads are paved. There is also no road designated as an exit construction. At equivalent intersections, drivers must give right of way to those coming from the right. Cyclists also fall into the category of drivers.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: Driving on hatched road markings is always prohibited. Hatched road markings are parts of a carriageway painted with diagonal stripes and are usually seen when the number of lanes on a carriageway change.

sorular.soru: Which lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: You must use dipped headlights when driving through tunnels. You must switch on the dipped headlights well in advance of entering a tunnel.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the red car here?

feedback.metin: The red car is approaching the priority triangles; you are driving at a priority intersection. You are therefore allowed to drive ahead of the red car.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn around after the intersection?

feedback.metin: You must follow the direction of travel indicated on the sign. The sign does not indicate a one-way street. You may not turn left or right here. You are allowed to turn around or reverse before or after the intersection.

sorular.soru: Which sign indicates closure to snorfietsen?
cevaplar: Only the C-13 and C-15 signs.
Only the C-14 and C-15 signs.

feedback.metin: The C-14 sign indicates that the road is closed to cyclists and drivers of disabled vehicles without an engine. As snorfietsen follow the rules applicable to cyclists, this road is also closed to them. The C-13 sign indicates that the road is closed to mopeds, snorfietsen and motorised vehicles for the disabled. The C-15 sign indicates that the road is closed to cyclists, mopeds, snorfietsen, and disabled vehicles.

sorular.soru: What should you do when aquaplaning?
cevaplar: Brake hard and correct your steering.
Keep accelerating and correct your steering.
Release the accelerator and press the clutch.
sorular.dogruCevap: Release the accelerator and press the clutch.

feedback.metin: When aquaplaning, your vehicle loses contact with the road surface due to the presence of a water film between the tyre and road surface. When the rev counter unexpectedly goes up without accelerating, this can be recognised as aquaplaning. The steering wheel also ceases to work. In the event of aquaplaning, the best course of action is to release the accelerator and press the clutch, keeping the steering wheel straight. Once you sense the vehicle regaining grip, you can carefully release the clutch, accelerate, and steer.

sorular.soru: Which lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: On this dark road, your visibility is obstructed and you are not easily visible to other road uses. You must use dipped headlights here to improve your visibility and so that other road users can see you. When visibility is obstructed during daytime, you must use dipped headlights.

sorular.soru: Do you have to have insurance for a car which is parked on your driveway and unused for an extended period of time?

feedback.metin: All motor carriages that are registered on someone's name in the national vehicle register, have to have insurance. Even if they are not used for an extended period of time. The only way to avoid having to insure your vehicle is to suspend it. But then the vehicle must also be completely withdrawn from traffic. So for instance, parked in a garage or in your backyard. The CBR will not ask questions about such exceptions.

sorular.soru: Which part of the road is the main carriageway?

feedback.metin: The main carriageway is the part of the road on which you can continue driving straight ahead. This includes the lanes that continue to follow the road. Hard shoulders and exit lanes do not belong to the main carriageway. In this case, part B is the main carriageway. Part C is a lane.

sorular.soru: Which sign applies to a passenger car?

feedback.metin: A supplementary plate below a traffic sign can indicate whether or not the road sign applies to certain vehicles. If the supplementary plate indicates a pictogram of one or more vehicles, the traffic sign only applies to those vehicles. If the text 'uitgezonderd' appears above, the road sign applies to all other vehicles except those indicated on the bottom sign. Sign 1 applies to all vehicles except bicycles and mopeds. So it does apply to cars. Sign 2 applies only to cars and motorcycles.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: The passenger car’s lighting is not fully visible. The bicycle carrier must therefore be equipped with lighting to compensate for this – two red rear lights, two red brake lights, two red retroreflectors, and two amber indicators.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here if you are towing a trailer?

feedback.metin: On autowegen and motorways, motor vehicles with trailers have a maximum allowed speed of 90 km/h, unless signs indicate a lower speed limit.

sorular.soru: Should you maintain the same tyre pressure for winter tyres as for summer tyres?

feedback.metin: The same recommended tyre pressure applies to all tyres. The recommended tyre pressure can be found on a sticker in the door opening or in the vehicle's instruction booklet.

sorular.soru: Should the pedestrian on the right give way to you?

feedback.metin: The pedestrian must give way to you before crossing the road. You do not have to give way to a pedestrian coming from the left or the right, unless there is a pedestrian crossing or if you are driving into or out of an exit construction. Pedestrians are not drivers.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to use the front fog lights in this situation?

feedback.metin: The front fog lights may be used when visibility is significantly obstructed due to fog, rain, or snow. Visibility of less than 200 metres is used as a guideline. The rear fog lights may only be used when visibility is less than 50 metres due to fog or snow. Using the rear fog lights is prohibited in heavy rain, as it may blind other road users.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane?

feedback.metin: This lane is closed, as indicated by the red cross on the digital sign above the lane. You cannot drive here.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you are stopped in the middle of an intersection after an accident that has resulted in minor bumper damage?
cevaplar: First park the car on the side, then take care of the damage.
Take care of the damage, then move the car.
Call the police and do not move the car until they arrive.
sorular.dogruCevap: First park the car on the side, then take care of the damage.

feedback.metin: If you have been involved in an accident resulting in minor damage where the car or cars is/are still drivable, always move the vehicle(s) safely out of the road as soon as possible before dealing with any damage. You are only required to call the police in case of more severe damage, or if the other party does not want to provide details such as their identity or insurance information.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake on the right?

feedback.metin: The vehicle in front has indicated that it wants to turn to the left and is pre-sorted. You are only allowed to overtake on the right. Overtaking, when done safely, will improve the traffic flow.

sorular.soru: Do drivers who continue to follow the roundabout always have right of way over drivers who want to enter the roundabout?

feedback.metin: Whether drivers have priority on the roundabout depends on the presence of signs on the road. In the vast majority of roundabouts, priority will be controlled by sign B-6 (triangular sign pointing downwards) and you should therefore give way to drivers on the intersecting road, i.e. the roundabout when entering the roundabout. But there are roundabouts without these signs, where the rule 'drivers give way to drivers from the right' simply applies. In that case, drivers driving on the roundabout must give way to drivers entering the roundabout.

sorular.soru: Is it allowed to transport a child on your lap?

feedback.metin: You must never have a child on your lap while driving. Not even if there are no seat belts left. Children smaller than 1.35 metres must use a car seat or booster seat with seat belt. Children taller than 1.35 metres must at least use the seat belt. Never transport more people than there are seats and belts. If you take a child on your lap while driving and there is a collision, this child will be trapped between the adult and the tensioned seat belt. This can be very dangerous and cause serious injury or even death.

sorular.soru: How is night defined?
cevaplar: The period between 11:00 pm and 7:00 am.
The period between 6:00 pm and 6:00 am.
The period between sunset and sunrise.
sorular.dogruCevap: The period between sunset and sunrise.

feedback.metin: Daytime is defined as the period between sunrise and sunset. The period between sunset and sunrise is defined as night. For some traffic rules, it is important to know whether it is day or night, for example when using lights.

sorular.soru: Are you in a 30 km-zone here?

feedback.metin: After passing the G-5 sign you are inside an erf. The roads within an erf are not meant for through traffic but have a residential function. There are often a lot of pedestrians and playing children. This is why drivers are not allowed to drive faster than 15 km/h within an erf.

sorular.soru: You are 17 years old and just received your passenger car (B) driving licence. Are you allowed to ride on a moped without supervision?

feedback.metin: When you receive a passenger car (B) licence, you also get a moped (AM) licence. Minors driving cars must be accompanied by an adult until the age of 18. As mopeds can be ridden from the age of 16, this requirement does not apply to this category. As soon as you have a driving licence for a passenger car, you are also allowed to ride a moped without supervision.

sorular.soru: Are you required to give way to a pedestrian who has difficulty walking when crossing?

feedback.metin: Drivers must always give way to all persons with reduced mobility and blind people with a white stick with one or more red rings. This also applies if there is no pedestrian crossing. This, however, does not apply to people in wheelchairs or disabled vehicles.

sorular.soru: Is it allowed to overtake on the right here?

feedback.metin: If there is a traffic jam, you may overtake the traffic jam on the right. In this case, you may simply drive past the cars, regardless of whether there is block marking. Please note that at the last moment drivers from the middle lane may decide to go to the right lane. Therefore, adjust your speed and drive along the traffic jam with a small difference in speed.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a malfunctioning parking brake?

feedback.metin: One of the legal requirements for driving a car is that it must be fitted with a properly functioning parking brake.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to call a garage regarding a technical fault with your car?

feedback.metin: This is a lay-by, which you may only use in case of a breakdown or an emergency situation. Using a lay-by as a rest stop, to make a phone call, or to check a map is prohibited. Calling a garage regarding a technical malfunction with your vehicle is categorised as dealing with a breakdown and is therefore allowed at a lay-by.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here if you are in possession of a disabled parking card?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a disabled parking space, which you can only use if you have a disabled parking card. However, there is another sign underneath with a registration number. Only the vehicle with the corresponding number plate is allowed to park here.

sorular.soru: Does a catalytic converter reduce the emission of harmful substances?

feedback.metin: Catalytic converters convert three harmful components of the exhaust gas (carbon monoxide, hydrocarbons and nitrogen oxide) into less harmful substances such as carbon dioxide, nitrogen and water vapour. As a result, they emit fewer harmful substances. A catalytic converter only works properly when the temperature in the catalytic converter is high enough (above 250 degrees Celsius).

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop in a safe place and check the oil level.
Stop immediately and check the oil level.
Stop at a safe place and refill engine oil immediately.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and check the oil level.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, it means that there is something wrong with the oil level. Usually, it is too low. Because the light is not red, you do not have to stop immediately, but you can drive to a safe place such as a car park or petrol station. Always check the oil first before refilling it, if necessary. Excessive oil levels can also cause problems.

sorular.soru: What do you do if this motorcycle wants to overtake you in a traffic jam?
cevaplar: In this lane, move carefully to the right.
Nothing. They are not allowed to pass the traffic jam.
In this lane, move carefully to the left.
sorular.dogruCevap: In this lane, move carefully to the right.

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to overtake traffic jams. In doing so, they must comply with a number of rules of conduct, for example, that they may only pass the traffic jam between the two lanes on the left. Also, the speed difference with the traffic jam may only be up to a maximum of 10 km/h. To let the motorcyclist pass safely, you have to move to the right in this central lane.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly?

feedback.metin: You have already turned your wheels in the direction you want to turn. This means that if you are in a rear-end collision, you will be forced into oncoming traffic. If you are pre-sorted, you should always position your wheels facing forwards if possible.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to drop off a passenger?
cevaplar: Yes. But only to pick up or drop off a passenger.
No. You are not allowed to stop here, or on the bus lane.
No. That is only allowed on the bus lane.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You are not allowed to stop here, or on the bus lane.

feedback.metin: You may not voluntarily stop your vehicle on the bus lane or in the carriageway next to the bus lane. You are not allowed to stop to pick up or drop off a passenger, not even at the bus stop.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive this trailer of which the rubber of the overrun brake is torn?

feedback.metin: All parts of the brake system must not be rusted, damaged, torn or broken. Therefore, the brakes must always function properly. If this is not the case, you may not drive the trailer.

sorular.soru: When is snow the most dangerous?

feedback.metin: In case of freshly fallen snow, you must be careful of slippery conditions and therefore adjust your speed and driving style. However, if the snow is compressed, it turns into an ice plate and is even slipperier. Your braking distance is even longer, and you will have to turn even slower. When the snow starts to melt, the slipperiness decreases somewhat.

sorular.soru: Can you turn left here?

feedback.metin: The F-7 sign means no turning. In this situation, you are allowed to turn left, but you cannot turn around. Always keep in mind that other drivers may turn around anyway.
